data.title: Great breakfast burrito!
data.text: Apparently the best breakfast burrito places are on Arizona Ave.  The one that I like was closed, so I saw this one and wandered in.  It was great!  The menu was simple, easy to navigate and the lady behind the counter was very helpful as well.  The prices were very reasonable and the burrito was really good.  You wouldn't think it would be hard to get a good breakfast burrito in this area, but I have found it to be a challenge.  Maybe I am just particular in how I like them made?  Either way, Elmer's makes them the way I like and my friend thought they were great as well.  I highly recommend the breakfast burritos!  It is my guess by other reviews that lunch and dinner is great as well.  I will let you know!  They have squeeze bottles of salsa in the cooler as well, great for the massive burrito that they made me!

data.title: Iconic
data.text: This restaurant has been in Chandler for years and years and we finally decided to give it a try! Do yourself a favor and avoid lunchtime when school is in session. Elmer's sits right across the street from Chandler High School. It's total chaos during the school lunch hour! The food is cheap and good. I especially like that I can get a mini chimi or a mini burrito. I love their beef tacos. Good salsa. Very quick service. There is patio dining but it's on a busy street. Indoor dining area is small but since this is a fast food place that's normal. Overall we liked the food and will go back.

data.title: Looks like a Filiberto's, but food is better!
data.text: Tried the bean and cheese cone, machaca cone and strips. All were good.  Strips are very different have shredded, but not melted cheese.   I look forward to trying something from the breakfast menu.

data.title: Came for breakfast-back for lunch!
data.text:
We are visiting family here and stopped in for breakfast. We are here from south Texas and we massively impressed by the friendliest and service of Elmer's. Sadly places like this in Texas are not as welcoming to us gringos. 🙄
If you're staying anywhere near make a trip her for an amazing burrito or taco!
We could have split one...they are HUGH!

data.title: Busy
data.text: Not quite like I remember. Should of stopped at the strips and cheese which are still yummy but the burro left a pit of despair in my stomach

data.title: Not a fancy place, but GREAT food
data.text: My sister resides in Chandler and told me about the food at Elmers.  It certainly isn't a fancy place and has only a couple of tables to sit, but wow...the food is great.  Best tacos I've had in years and the burros were amazing, too.

data.title: Chandler High School Landmark for years now
data.text: Good people all working together to make the American dream come true. I like the friendly staff each time I come in. Reasonable Mexican cuisine along with budget specials for the students.

data.title: Killer food
data.text: Elmers has been a staple for a very long time. They have amazing food, the people are great, and you feel like family when your here.  I hope to continue coming here for years to come.

data.title: Great tacos for a small price
data.text: Good tacos , 2 for $4 and have not tried anything else, but all food is very reasonable, mostly suggest take-out.  Waits can be long as it is very popular.

data.title: Best Mexican
data.text: A transplant to the valley I have been searching for flavorful Mexican food and have tried over a dozen different places from hole in the walls to upscale sit down places. This is hands down the best.

data.title: AWESOME BURROS!
data.text: If you stop by for lunch, you will probably be swarmed by high school students, but it is SO worth it. I am not a burro person, but always get theirs when I am in the neighborhood. Great Mexican food!

data.title: CHS Get Together
data.text: Joined CHS friends their for lunch is was good food and good conversation just as I had remembered. I still crave the green chili burritos!

data.title: Muy Bien!
data.text:
This is my favorite "hole-in-the-wall" Mexican restaurant in Chandler.

I like the mini-chimis, with taco, beans and rice. 

I also like the nachos. They are unique because the cheese is not melted.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: It pains me to say how disappointed we were this last time we went. I have been going to Elmer's on and off for over 20 years... I was raised in chandler so we always had Elmers. This last time we went the staff was different. There is this new "American lady" who had no idea what she was doing. I asked for a chicken burrito(at Elmer's it's a staple) she proceeded to ask me what type of chicken I wanted? There's only one type everyone usually orders. The husband wanted a Carne asada burrito combo. This place has gone crazy with the fillers. Why would we order a combo which comes with rice and beans then have rice and beans inside the burrito? For 9 bucks it would make sense just for meat in the damn thing. The strips and cheese were the same so that was great and the salsa hasn't changed thank goodness. Don't think we will be continuing our tradition coming here. Might need to find a better place...

data.title: First Time, Will Return
data.text: We met another couple that had eaten at Elmer's before.  Ordered a la carte to sample various items.  It's easy to understand why they're a favorite because their food is the closest to traditional Mexican that we've had in years.  We left full & satisfied.  Staff was friendly & very helpful.  Suggest not over ordering...you can always go back up & order more.  The service quick.

data.title: Three T's and Great Taste
data.text: Great  Authentic Mexican Food is hard to find, BUT don't look any further, Elmer's is true authentic.  Tacos, tamales, sweet Tea, beans, rice, chips and salsa it's all good.  Just like momma use to make.  You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Reviews too favorable?
data.text: My mother and I ate at Elmer's on Feb 24.  She wasn't hungry so I ordered the carne asada and the fish tacos and a machaca mini-burro.  I had horchata to drink.  Cashier and staff were helpful and friendly when I had questions.  All of my food and the horchata were delicious but I wouldn't say they were, 'legendary.'  However, it is clearly a popular place for locals, including those of Hispanic ancestry.  So if you're in the area, stop by Elmer's for a genuine Chandler experience.

data.title: There is a reason it has survived!
data.text:
This place has been here for decades. 
The food is amazing. 
My favorite would be the fry bread tacos. 
The Machaca Fry Bread taco is amazing. 
The serving is huge so don't try to order a ton at a time. I just walk back up if I have room for more. 
The beef machaca is fabulous & my friends love the chicken machaca. 
The burritos & regular tacos are amazing. 

This is a family business. 
They are hard to spot from the street so watch closely. 
They are authentic. 
Refills are not free, but who cares. 
There are sometimes lines & you may wait to be helped. When you are ordering they are so great about answering questions & very patient. 

Check out their website in advance if it helps. 
www.elmerstacos.com
I brought home a menu to look over before going in. 
We live more than 20 miles away but it is  definitely worth the drive

data.title: Good find
data.text:
Was in the neighborhood and needed a quick lunch.  stopped based on review.  A small hole in the wall.  I had the pastor tacos.  The tacos reminded me of the street tacos in Rocky Point.  Very tasty.  I am looking forward to going back and try something else. 
Cons -- small..not many places to sit and enjoy...refills not free..,chips and salsa are extra

The good outweighs the bad!!!!

data.title: Favorite Dive for Mexican Food!
data.text: Huge portions, great prices, authentic Mexican food made from scratch!  Atmosphere is nothing to write home about, but the food over shadows that-- or hey take your great food to-go!  Elmer's Tacos is a favorite spot to grab lunch when we visit AZ.
